title: epoc02
author: epoc02
content: This is my first post so I'm very new here still not totally sure what to do. I would like to open a bitcoin and other cryptocurrency trading business on the dark web. By trading I mean anything in an exchange. If anyone's interested in helping program the site and help run it in exchange for a percentage of the profits please let me know.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: And what will you be bringing to the table? Because from your post you don’t have knowledge about bitcoin or crypto as a whole, you know nothing about how exchanges work, you don’t have programming knowledge, nothing at all. Or will you be entirely in charge of financing the project?

comments.author: epoc02
comments.body: This is still very first initial ideas everything off the top of my head. I just wanted to get out there and ask about to work on my idea and see if its plausible. I can program to an extent I just want more than just me working on a project this size.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: epoc02 on October 16, 2023, 06:11:17 PMThis is my first post so I'm very new here still not totally sure what to do. I would like to open a bitcoin and other cryptocurrency trading business on the dark web. By trading I mean anything in an exchange. First and foremost how will you establish the trust between you and your users? In a licensed exchange users are trusting the license providers at least.I don't think creating an exchange even from the scratch is a big deal. In fact these days you can have ready made scripts from trusted sources and run your own exchange with a little knowledge about crypto and it's tech. QuoteIf anyone's interested in helping program the site and help run it in exchange for a percentage of the profits please let me know. Why will anyone need you? They can have their own exchange without expecting a percentage from you.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: First of all, do you have at least some experience with dark web that you want to open exchange there? It's completely different thing than opening exchange on "surface" web.Building exchange it's not a problem. More important how you're planning to build your trust that people would use your service? Don't get me wrong, but I'm not sure that you're realy serious or it's just random business idea without any knowledge and plans how to make it working.

comments.author: Broadanbig
comments.body: OP from the way you sound, it seems you don't have knowledge about what you want to go into so how are you sure your developers would give you a clean clear work void of leakage and how would the community trust you to protect their assets they put in your custody. Who is going to bank roll the project for you when you can not even read computer code to know what a developer is using for your project. Do you think building an exchange as you have said is something you could just one day start talking about when you have no knowledge about? I will suggest you take your time to look into it and try do a little study on it .

comments.author: Text
comments.body: I agree with @Cantsay that you need to do some more research and planning before you get started.A few things to consider:What is your unique selling proposition? Why should people trade cryptocurrencies on your exchange instead of another one?What kind of users are you targeting? Experienced traders or beginners?What features and services will you offer? Margin trading? Derivatives? A variety of cryptocurrencies?How will you ensure the security of your users' funds?How will you comply with applicable laws and regulations?Once you have a good understanding of these things, you can start to think about programming your exchange. This is a complex task, so it's important to find experienced developers who have experience with cryptocurrency exchanges and the dark web.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Making it on the dark web does not mean that it is safe or highly private. It is true that you will not be able to collect IPs and tracking data, but the users who will use your service will have better technical knowledge and therefore you need to create something special to make them use your service, and you will be under the eyes of the authorities as you are running an illegal activity that contrary to licensing regulations.To start with exchange, you need a lot of liquidity and a good technical and marketing team, but to succeed, you need more than that, so provide more details.

comments.author: epoc02
comments.body: Thank you to everyone who gave there ideas and insights to the project. Im expecting this to take a long time and im not thinking this will be an overnight process. I will take everyones ideas and support into consideration.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: epoc02 on October 18, 2023, 04:27:17 PMThank you to everyone who gave there ideas and insights to the project. Im expecting this to take a long time and im not thinking this will be an overnight process. I will take everyones ideas and support into consideration.Everything starts with what you want all the previous recommendations and suggestions here in your thread are to make you aware of the many obstacles that you're going to face, you have a different idea because honestly, this is the first time I've read someone wants to work on the dark web right away with ample knowledge about the dark web.I think it is better to explore the dark web since this is the place you want to work, explore, and learn everything about the dark web and how they do business here you will need a mentor who has work similar to what you want to aspire to.

comments.author: noormcs5
comments.body: Quote from: epoc02 on October 16, 2023, 06:11:17 PMThis is my first post so I'm very new here still not totally sure what to do. I would like to open a bitcoin and other cryptocurrency trading business on the dark web. By trading I mean anything in an exchange. If anyone's interested in helping program the site and help run it in exchange for a percentage of the profits please let me know.Just a question for you, why do you want to open a crypto exchange on the dark web and why not open it on the normal Web? What is so special about the exchange business in darkweb? Do you know any existing dark web exchange   Also opening an exchange requires a lot of money, not open to setup the exchange only but also to run it and of course, you need a budget for marketing too. Do you have that much budget? I hope you know the difference between trading on an exchange and owning your own exchange.
